parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Freedom, liberty, especially: a state of freedom from slavery. From eleutheros; freedom.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Corruption, destruction, decay, rottenness, decomposition. From phtheiro; decay, i.e. Ruin.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To enslave. From doulos; to enslave.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as hetton; to make worse, i.e. Vanquish; by implication, to rate lower.
